title: UR Vaccine and Treatment Evaluation Unit (VTEU)
cleaned_text: Vaccine and Treatment Evaluation Unit (VTEU) UR Vaccine and Treatment Evaluation Unit (VTEU) Co-Principal Investigators Ann Falsey, MD and Angela Branche, MD The UR Vaccine and Treatment Evaluation Unit (VTEU), directed by [Ann R. Falsey, M.D.](https://www.urmc.rochester.edu/people/23030152-ann-regina-falsey), and [Angela R. Branche, M.D.](https://www.urmc.rochester.edu/people/27926178-angela-branche), conducts clinical trials of new vaccines, treatments and diagnostics for a variety of infectious diseases backed by NIH funding. Areas of study include: - Development of vaccines and treatments for SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) - Development of a universal flu vaccine - Development of treatments for respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) and other respiratory diseases - Development of treatments for resistant sexually transmitted diseases As part of our mission, the VTEU welcomes applications from junior researchers interested in NIH funding to conduct infectious diseases research.
